duck: Staging (cooking), a chef works briefly and without pay in another chef's kitchen to learn new techniques and cuisines
Staging (rocketry), the use of multiple engines and propellant to launch a rocket
Disk staging, using disks as an additional, temporary stage of backup process before finally storing backup
Staging (data), intermediately storing data between the sources of information and a data warehouse (DW)
Staging (websites), a website used to assemble, test and review its newer versions before it is moved into production
Staging (theatre), the process of selecting, designing, adapting to, or modifying the performance space for a play or film
Staging (stagecoaches), the business of running stagecoaches or the act of journeying in them
Home staging, preparing a residence for sale in real estate
Staging area, a location used to prepare items for use, such as for a military operation
Cancer staging, a description (usually numbers I to V) of how much the cancer has spread

milestones: Mass industrial walkouts in UK
Police evict Vestas protesters
Allegations President Bush staged photo-ops in aftermath of Hurricane Katrina tragedy
Senator Landrieu accuses President Bush of staging photo-ops amidst
Norwegian national assembly votes to allow same-sex marriage and adoption
Chinese hostage rescued in the Philippines
NFL Europa ceases after 15 seasons
Feminist gathering in Tehran dispersed by police
Rio de Janeiro to host 2016 Olympics
Councilman: Buffalo, New York, USA police to stage "sickout"
London 21 July suspect claims device was 'flour bomb'
FEMA accused of misusing trained disaster workers as public-relations workers
Fiji Military Coup possibly underway
Germany to host 2011 FIFA Women's World Cup
13-year-old shot dead by Brazilian police in mock-up of hijacking situation
National Guard dispatched to Buffalo, New York to help with storm cleanup
UK policeman convicted of murdering WPC fiancée who died after staged car crash
Suicide bombers blast two Bangladeshi cities
French police detain 20 terror suspects in dawn raid
Golf: Tseng successfully defends her title in Thailand
British conductor Edward Downes and wife die in double assisted suicide

wiki.text:
'Staging' may refer to:
* Staging area, a location used to prepare items for use, such as for a
  military operation
* Staging (cooking), a chef works briefly and without pay in another chef's
  kitchen to learn new techniques and cuisines
* Staging (rocketry), the use of multiple engines and propellant to
  launch a rocket
* Staging, temporary work platforms
* Staging (stagecoaches), the business of running stagecoaches or the act of
  journeying in them
* Staging (theatre), the process of selecting, designing, adapting to, or
  modifying the performance space for a play or film
* Staging (websites), a website used to assemble, test and review its newer
  versions before it is moved into production
* Cancer staging, a description (usually numbers I to V) of how much the cancer
  has spread
* Home staging, preparing a residence for sale in real estate
* in computing: ** Staging (data), intermediately storing data between the
  sources of information and a data warehouse (DW) ** Disk staging, using
  disks as an additional, temporary stage of backup process before finally
  storing backup
* Staging, the process of aligning cars on the starting line in drag racing
* Staging, in bird migration the practice of pausing at places along a migration
  route to rest and feed before proceeding
wiki.title: staging
